name: Vote Analyze
short_description:
I made this program to take the raw data I had collected from the state primaries and caucuses (precincts mostly) and generate the kinds of data that can be used to graph the voting trends and allow statistics to be done to confirm or clear the suspicions of vote fraud in the 2012 GOP nominating process.

It is completely open source, and I have already generated the output for you. I include all of my sources of data, as well as my trimmed / slightly formatted versions of them (to work as input into the program).

v1.3
	-Fixed bug added in v1.2 when empty last
	column bug was fixed, causing last candidate
	in spreadsheet to be dropped
	-Added 1996 data
	-Removed extra "Massachusettes" output

v1.2.1
	-Fixed accidental copy of Missouri data into Minnesota

-See README for older changelog information
summary: A program to calculated needed stats to check the 2012 GOP nomination
